properties.name: Back to Back Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Paiges    Worker Owned!PAWC Directory: We are a worker owned cafe serving a diverse customer base in the central eastside of Portland. Commited to serving organic, fair-trade coffee and good cheap food. Hours: Weds-Mon 8am to 10pm. Tues 8am-8pm. Vegan and vegetarian food, boks for prisoners drop off, bi-lingual classes for day workers, the nicest damn servers in town. please tip, its the only money they make. Oh! and free internet. back2backcafe@yahoo.com

properties.name: Crystal Ballroom
properties.description: Posted by Kaptinqwin 1332 W. Burnside portland, ori saw the arcade fire here and they marched out onto burnside and played for 20 minutes or so. there were so many people it stopped trafic going both ways. wow! the ball room has bad sound, a bouncy floor and over priced drinks and beer

properties.name: Kellys Olympian
properties.description: Posted by Kaptinqwin  426 sw washington portland, or3rd oldest bar in porltand. stiff drinks, decent food. cool decor makes you feel like your in a las vegas motorcycle garage. big flat screens usually with skating on. ask for a black and blue

properties.name: Liberty Hall
properties.description: Posted by Paiges  Worker-Owned!PAWC directory: A volunteer powered collectively run community center for cultural, political and community groups. Hosting several events per week including classes, benefits, concerts, meetings,videos, cooking Food Not Bombs, private parties and almonst anything else you or your organization can dream up. Hours Sun-Fri 11:30-6pm plus scheduled events

properties.name: Nicolas Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Paiges  Vegan Pdxhuge spinach pies for 4 bucks, vegan and veggie and meat. crazed crowded and always delicious. cheap and good.

properties.name: Paradox Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Paiges   Vegan Pdxvegan and vegetarian food. owned by Jimbo the same guy that runs the Vita on Alberta. Paradox is kinds like Vita\'s kid brother that everyone ignores. Paradox food simply isnt as good or as cared for as the Vita\'s. Rumor has it the staff is treated better at Vita too. maybe there is a correlation. If you are going to Paradox be prepared for a long wait. The service is always sloooow. But the Servers are friendly and cute. Eat the corn cakes, multi-grain pancakes and soups, burritos and fancy cakes. Avoid the rotating menus, frankly i cant tell if they even taste half of the stuff they advertise before it goes o the menu. Trust me I love this restaurant...I just feel sorry for it is all.

properties.name: Project Hello
properties.description: Posted by Jason Photograph homeless people with big "hello, my name is..." signs. Simple, but strong and very human. The show is over now.

properties.name: Shanghai Tunnel
properties.description: Posted by Kaptinqwin  211 Sw Ankeny St, Portland, ORpeanut noodle bowls here with fried tofu are amazing (im not even veggie) good drinks, great outdoor seating and a dark underground bar area, good for hiding out. pinball, new pool table. i likes the shanhai!

properties.name: The Red Light
properties.description: Posted by Paiges  Vintage, Resale, Trendy, Designer ClothesWarehouse sized vintage, thrift style store, resale. clothes, shoes, jackets, accesories, belts, great halloween spot. they rotate their stock regularly. you know you shop there so dont lie to me.fashionistas abound. moderate prices, face it- they got it all. I like tace very much so i wont say crap about the place thats bad. she\'\'s a cancer. she\'\'s my fam.

properties.name: Voodoo Doughnuts
properties.description: Posted by Jason     22 SW 3rd Ave, portland, orCocoa Puff doughnuts, voodoo doll doughnuts, cock&balls doughnuts. Only open in the middle of hte night, 10pm - 10am. Mostly organic locally grown ingredients too! OOh, they have eating contests, bands play there etc. http://www.voodoodoughnut.com/

properties.name: Wedding Location: Horning's Hideout
properties.description: Posted by Jason    A huge private park area with a lake, a pond, a creek, rolling grass hills, a big huge stage, camping, paddle boats, and dozens of peacocks wandering around the grounds.
